title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: These acquaintances I owe to the friendship of Dr.Carlyle." The Robertson in question was William Robert-Robertson son, D.D., the historian, who died inI793, in the Grange House, still standing south of the Grange Cemetery; \-Vallace wasWallace Robert Wallace, D.D., author of the"Dissertation on the Numbers of Mankind," who died in the then suburban village ofBlair Broughton in I771; Blair was HughBlair, D.D., the rhetorician, who was theﬁrst to introduce the poems of Ossian to the world,who occupied Hume's apartments in James's Courtwhen Hume was on the Continent, who once livedin Argyle Square, and who was buried in the Greyfriars' Churchyard, his monument standing on theWilma south side of the church; \Vilkie was\/Villiam '\/Vilkie, D.D., whom HenryMackenzie in his "Life of Home " called the "Scot-3*
